Sentencas: Understanding the sintering mechanism of Ni in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode is one of the important issues to discuss the long-term durability of SOFC performance.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: The sintering behavior of Ni is affected not only by the operating temperature but also by the gas composition in the anode chamber.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: We analyzed the surface diffusion of a Ni adatom and Ni complexes on the Ni(111) surface under the operating.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: temperature and gas compositions in the anode by using density functional theory.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: The Ni adatom, Ni-H and Ni-S complexes, which can be formed by H-2 and H2S in anode gas, were considered as diffusion species on the surface.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: It is theoretically confirmed that the formation of a NiS complex influences the sintering behavior of Ni depending on the temperature and the impurity H2S concentration in the fuel.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: Our calculated results are, compared with the experimental observation on Ni sintering under various temperatures and H2S concentrations to find a good agreement.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition

Sentencas: We clearly showed the important effect of gas composition in the anode on the sintering properties of Ni in the SOFC anode.
Titulo: Density Functional Theory Study for Ni Diffusion on Ni(111) Surface under Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operating Condition
